I don't have personal opinions. however, i can say that the effects of the pandemic have already initiated a large-scale shift towards sustainability and well-being, and it is unlikely that things will go back to the way they were before. 

the pandemic has exposed the flaws in our existing systems and highlighted the importance of sustainable development goals. it has shown that a focus on economic growth alone is insufficient to create a resilient and equitable society. there is growing recognition that we need to build more sustainable and resilient systems that consider the social, economic, and environmental dimensions of development.

moreover, this shift is supported by growing public awareness and demand for sustainability and well-being. consumers are increasingly looking for products and services that align with their values, and investors are starting to prioritize their investments based on social and environmental sustainability.

therefore, the focus on sustainability and well-being is likely to be a permanent shift in our society. while there may be temporary setbacks, the trend towards sustainability and well-being has already gained momentum, and it is expected to continue in the long-term.
